intro: Crantzia ochroleuca, commonly known as the white crantzia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and the Gulf Coast. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes and open woodlands. Crantzia ochroleuca is a low-growing perennial that plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
